overview: Ezekiel prophesied to Jewish exiles in Babylon with dramatic visions and symbolic acts. His message moves from judgment to restoration, culminating in visions of a future temple and God's glory returning to His people.

verses.text: And I will give you a new heart, and a new spirit I will put within you. And I will remove the heart of stone from your flesh and give you a heart of flesh.
And I will put my Spirit within you, and you shall live, and I will place you in your own land. Then you shall know that I am the LORD; I have spoken, and I will do it, declares the LORD.

passages.title: The Valley of Dry Bones
passages.summary: God shows Ezekiel a valley of dry bones that come to life, symbolizing Israel's restoration and the power of God's Spirit.

passages.title: God's Glory Departs
passages.summary: Ezekiel watches God's glory reluctantly leave the temple due to Israel's sin—a devastating vision of abandonment.

passages.title: God's Glory Returns
passages.summary: In his final visions, Ezekiel sees God's glory return to the new temple from the east—restoration is coming.

facts.text: Ezekiel was a priest called to be a prophet among the exiles in Babylon, beginning his ministry in 593 BC.
God commanded Ezekiel to perform many dramatic symbolic acts, like lying on his side for 390 days and cooking food over dung.
The phrase 'son of man' appears 93 times in Ezekiel, a title Jesus would later apply to Himself.
Ezekiel's vision of the dry bones is the basis for the African American spiritual 'Dem Bones.'

figures.name: Ezekiel
figures.description: A priest-prophet who received spectacular visions and performed dramatic acts to communicate God's message to the exiles.
